content:
• Tuesday, August 7, 2012
  • BKI-OLD

    Buckeye Technologies (NYSE:BKI-OLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $225M (-10%...

    Buckeye Technologies (NYSE:BKI-OLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $225M (-10% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)

  • CTRP

    While other online travel firms are slumping due to Priceline's bad news, China's Ctrip.com...

    While other online travel firms are slumping due to Priceline's bad news, China's Ctrip.com (NASDAQ:CTRP) is up 5.5% AH after announcing a partnership with Priceline's (PCLN) Booking.com unit. The deal will allow Ctrip users to make reservations at the 235K hotels supported by Booking.com. Ctrip says it currently offers reservations for 50K hotels. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • WCRX

    Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) declares special dividend of $4.00/share, payable on or before...

    Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) declares special dividend of $4.00/share, payable on or before 3Q12. The Company announced a new dividend policy to pay $0.50/share annually. Shares -5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • Z

    More on Zillow's Q2: The company expects Q3 revenue of $30M-$31M, in-line with a $30.3M...

    More on Zillow's Q2: The company expects Q3 revenue of $30M-$31M, in-line with a $30.3M consensus. However, adjusted EBITDA is expected to drop to $4.75M-$5.25M from Q2's $5.3M, which suggests EPS could miss a $0.06 consensus. Monthly unique users +5% Q/Q and +61% Y/Y to 33.5M, and Premier Agent subs rose by 4.1K to 22.7K. Also, more homes are now viewed on mobile devices than on PCs (previous). Z -12.6% AH, shares had rallied going into the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM

  • EXPE

    Online travel names head south in response to Priceline's soft Q3 guidance. EXPE -3.2% AH. TRIP...

    Online travel names head south in response to Priceline's soft Q3 guidance. EXPE -3.2% AH. TRIP -6.3%. Of particular concern is Priceline's guidance for a 12%-20% Y/Y increase in international gross bookings (heavily tied to Europe), which is well below Q2's 33%, not to mention Q1's 54%. Also, guidance for Q3 revenue growth of 9%-15% isn't close to a 24% consensus. OWW and TZOO could also be under pressure tomorrow. PCLN -15.4% AH. The CC has started (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 3 Comments

  • RAX

    More on Rackspace's Q2: Server count +3% Q/Q to 85K, total customers +6% to 191K, revenue/server...

    More on Rackspace's Q2: Server count +3% Q/Q to 85K, total customers +6% to 191K, revenue/server +3% to $1,270. Capex was $82M, 26% of revenue and flat Q/Q, and headcount rose by 193 to 4,528. But operating cash flow was up 44%. Public cloud hosting revenue +69% Y/Y, now 23% of total. Dedicated hosting revenue +21%. Churn steady at 0.8%. RAX now +7.7% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM

    Global Cash Access (GCA): Q2 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $147.5M (+9.,2% Y/Y) misses...

  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +16.2%) finished as a top gainer on investor enthusiasm that a planned...

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +16.2%) finished as a top gainer on investor enthusiasm that a planned sale of its South Henderson field in Texas and rising oil production will help the company - saddled with a debt that exceeds its market value - sort out its cash flow problems. GDP sees Q3 average oil volume at 3,200-3,600 bbl/day, a Q/Q increase of 14%-29%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM

    Compass Diversified (NYSE:CODI): Q2 EPS of $0.00 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.18. Revenue of $230M (+72.8% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)

    More on Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS): Q2 misses by a penny on higher net losses, which the company attributes to higher SG&A expenses tied to its pending launch of Qsymia. Shares -4.7% AH.

  • BKNG

    More on Priceline (PCLN): Expects total gross bookings to increase 10%-18% Y/Y in Q3, with...

    More on Priceline (PCLN): Expects total gross bookings to increase 10%-18% Y/Y in Q3, with domestic bookings 5% higher. Says its below-Street guidance reflects current operating trends as well as an assumption that economic conditions in Europe will deteriorate again. Shares -12.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 4 Comments

    Sapient (NASDAQ:SAPE): Q2 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $279M (+9.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Priceline (PCLN): Q2 EPS of $7.85 beats by $0.48. Revenue of $1.36B (+26.8% Y/Y) misses by $1M....

    Priceline (PCLN): Q2 EPS of $7.85 beats by $0.48. Revenue of $1.36B (+26.8% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Sees Q3 2012 EPS of $11.10-$11.12 vs. $12.82 consensus. Shares -8.5% AH. (PR)

    Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR): Q2 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $66.3M (+19.4% Y/Y)...

  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $306.8M (+26% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $306.8M (+26% Y/Y) beats by $0.5M. Expects FQ1 revenue of $305M-$325M, below $328.8M consensus. Expects FQ1 EPS of $0.23-$0.28, mostly below $0.28 consensus. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q2 EPS of $0.88 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $27.7B beats by $1.1B....

  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +9.3%) ramped higher today ahead of earnings and an upgrade to Buy at...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +9.3%) ramped higher today ahead of earnings and an upgrade to Buy at Lazard, citing an optimistic launch for the company's obesity drug Qsymia.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGI

    Biodiesel producer Renewable Energy (REGI +4.2%) gains today after saying it will offer...

    Biodiesel producer Renewable Energy (REGI +4.2%) gains today after saying it will offer wholesale biodiesel fuel under a new agreement with Maxum Petroleum at its Rancho Dominguez, California terminal near Long Beach. Maxum, one of the largest independent energy logistics companies in North America, will operate the terminal, which is expected to offer REGI's biodiesel to large fleets beginning mid-August.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • HPT

    Hospitality Properties Trust's (HPT -4%) Q2 earnings fell 27% and missed estimates as the REIT...

    Hospitality Properties Trust's (HPT -4%) Q2 earnings fell 27% and missed estimates as the REIT was hit by higher hotel operating costs and overhead expenses that masked revenue growth. HPT is in the midst of a two-year program to renovate its hotels, which should help long-term performance but is posing a short-term drag on occupancies and other metrics.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • TPX

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX +6.1%) trade higher with the company announcing the opening of its...

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX +6.1%) trade higher with the company announcing the opening of its first retail store in Natick, Massachusetts. In addition to its own proprietary bedding products, the store also features related items from other manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM

  • More on Endo Health Solutions ([[ENDP] +3.3%) worth noting: CEO David Holveck and CFO Alan Levin...

    More on Endo Health Solutions ([[ENDP] +3.3%) worth noting: CEO David Holveck and CFO Alan Levin both bought shares in June. Mr. Holveck scooped up 8500 shares at an average price of $29.23, while Mr. Levin bought 3200 shares at $29.68. The stock is currently trading higher, albeit marginally, at $30.77.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • FE

    FirstEnergy (FE -4.9%) had posted double-digit revenue growth for four straight quarters, but Q2...

    FirstEnergy (FE -4.9%) had posted double-digit revenue growth for four straight quarters, but Q2 revenue slipped 5% to $3.87B. Commodity margins fell due to lower average power prices and sales to the wholesale market, increased purchased power costs and fewer sales of renewable energy credits. FE reaffirms its full-year outlook for adjusted EPS of $3.30-$3.60.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Investors cheer Chesapeake's (CHK +9.2%) plans to sell another $5B in assets in the next year...

    Investors cheer Chesapeake's (CHK +9.2%) plans to sell another $5B in assets in the next year and a half (also), pushing shares near the top of the day's S&P leader board. But some analysts still say CHK has become too dependent on asset sales to provide liquidity, with "a flood of acreage deals available [and] weaker oil and gas pricing than before."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE +9.3%) is now up strongly after beating Q2 estimates and guiding on its...

    Demandware (DWRE +9.3%) is now up strongly after beating Q2 estimates and guiding on its earnings call for 2012 revenue of $75M-$76M, above a consensus of $73.6M. EPS is only expected to be in-line due to gross margin pressure. The strong top-line guidance comes in spite of declining revenue from 10% customer Neckermann, whose bankruptcy filing pressured Demandware last month. 1/3 of new Q2 customers came from Europe. (Goldman upgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • F

    Sherwin-Williams ([[SHW] +2.5%) says it's received an unsolicited, below-market mini-tender...

    Sherwin-Williams ([[SHW] +2.5%) says it's received an unsolicited, below-market mini-tender offer from TRC Capital to purchase up to 1M shares, approximately 0.97%, of its float, at $129.50 per share. The company recommends shareholders reject the offer. This isn't the first time TRC has tried to low-ball a bid for a company, it's made simlilar offers for Ford (NYSE:F), Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MRO) and a number of other companies in what the SEC calls an attempt to "catch investors off guard."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • AROC

    Exterran Holdings (EXH +12.2%) jumps after confirming it sold previously nationalized Venezuelan...

    Exterran Holdings (EXH +12.2%) jumps after confirming it sold previously nationalized Venezuelan assets for ~$442M. EXH received an initial $177M payment in cash at closing and is due to receive the remaining principal amount in periodic cash payments through Q3 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • FOSL

    The giant upward swing in shares of Fossil (FOSL +32.1%) is a result of a bout of short covering...

    The giant upward swing in shares of Fossil (FOSL +32.1%) is a result of a bout of short covering after the firm's Q2 report beat consensus estimates, according to analysts. The retailer overcame Europe sluggishness to kick up 23% more in watch sales than a year ago and strengthened its direct-to-consumer business. With short interest on FOSL at 4.061M shares, the numbers were good enough to catch at least a few traders napping.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • AKS

    Steel stocks are up again a day after AK Steel's surprising move to raise prices on...

    Steel stocks are up again a day after AK Steel's surprising move to raise prices on flat-rolled steel products just 10 days after an earlier increase: AKS +3.2%, X +1.2%, NUE +1.1%. But Axiom analyst Gordon Johnson senses an act of desperation, and notes AKS shares have dropped ~8% on average when it has announced two or more price hikes in the same month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • NUS

    Shares of Nu Skin (NUS -8.7%) are getting hit today on a Citron Research report accusing the...

    Shares of Nu Skin (NUS -8.7%) are getting hit today on a Citron Research report accusing the company of being in violation of "direct selling" rules in China, putting their entire Chinese business operation "in jeopardy of seizure." Citron notes that NUS' China business comprised almost 75% of its Y/Y revenue growth in Q2, making the risk of its China operations coming to an abrupt halt massive, and the consequences devastating. Herbalife (HLF -1.7%) and Usana Health Services (USNA -3.7%) also trade down on the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM

  • Vitamin Shoppe ([[VSI] +6.7%) moves up on a solid Q2 earnings beat, driven by solid top line...

    Vitamin Shoppe ([[VSI] +6.7%) moves up on a solid Q2 earnings beat, driven by solid top line growth and strong retail sales. Net sales rose 13.4% Y/Y, while operating income rose 35.9%. For FY12, the company expects to open 52 new stores and sees comp store sales growth in mid-single digits for the remainder of the year, as well as continued improvement in operating income margin.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • FSL

    Freescale (FSL +10.9%), LSI (LSI-OLD +5.8%), and Applied Materials (AMAT +4.9%) lead a major...

    Freescale (FSL +10.9%), LSI (LSI-OLD +5.8%), and Applied Materials (AMAT +4.9%) lead a major rally in chip stocks (SOXX +2.6%) after Goldman upgrades the companies. Discussing Freescale, Goldman argues downside to estimates is limited given soft guidance and a lean supply chain, and (more importantly for peers) the firm expects EPS to be "up significantly" in 2013 and 2014 thanks to a new chip industry up cycle. MU +5.4%. NXPI +5.8%. MRVL +4.8%. ATML +5.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    A number of beat-up momentum stocks run hot after their summer of discontent, with investors...

    A number of beat-up momentum stocks run hot after their summer of discontent, with investors apparently setting their tolerance for risk a bit higher without any clear cut impetus. Favored momo names Chipotle (CMG +3.9%), Tesla Motors (TSLA +7.5%), Lululemon (LULU +3.9%), Deckers (DECK +6.2%), and Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.7%) are all showing outsized gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +6%) jumps after the White House announces it will expedite seven solar and...

    First Solar (FSLR +6%) jumps after the White House announces it will expedite seven solar and wind projects, including First Solar's Silver State South Nevada project. Wind turbine component maker American Superconductor (AMSC +7.6%) is also among the day's big winners. FSLR is now up 36% since it delivered a huge Q2 beat, but remains down sharply on the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM +6.5%) rallies after Oppenheimer defends the mobile display ad network...

    Millennial Media (MM +6.5%) rallies after Oppenheimer defends the mobile display ad network owner ahead of tomorrow's Q2 report. The firm asserts Millennial "offers the best near-term solution for mobile monetization," and notes the mobile ad market is still growing quickly - eMarketer expects the U.S. market to nearly double this year - in spite of widespread concerns about its potential. Millennial has had a rough time since popping on IPO day.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • IPHS

    Shares of Innophos Holdings (IPHS -10.7%) sink after the specialty ingredients maker turns in a...

    Shares of Innophos Holdings (IPHS -10.7%) sink after the specialty ingredients maker turns in a Q2 profit well below Street estimates amid reduced market demand and higher raw material costs. IPHS expects to offset continued weaker market demand conditions in H2 via "ongoing success with growth initiatives," seeing H2 volume growth of 1%-3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • FLEX

    Flextronics (FLEX +8.4%) jumps after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm notes...

    Flextronics (FLEX +8.4%) jumps after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm notes Flextronics carries a free cash flow yield of 13% (maybe a little lower after today's move), and is raising its EPS estimates to account for rising margins and the impact of aggressive stock buybacks. BofA upgraded Flextronics on margin growth expectations in May. Also rallying: PLXS +3.6%. JBL +3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver (KWK +4.5%) says it's cutting its full-year capital expenditure budget by $50M to...

    Quicksilver (KWK +4.5%) says it's cutting its full-year capital expenditure budget by $50M to $360M citing reduced drilling activity. Q2 results were hurt by a $992M non-cash impairment of oil and gas properties due to lower prices. KWK lowers its 2012 production estimate to 365-380 MMcfe/day vs. its prior outlook of ~412 MMcfe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +5%) gets a lift after its subsidiary AAI Test & Training wins a contract from...

    Textron (TXT +5%) gets a lift after its subsidiary AAI Test & Training wins a contract from Orbital Sciences Corporation (ORB +2.7%) to provide several factory line test systems for its satellite production lines. The testers will be used to screen sections of multiple satellites as they are built, as well as the fully assembled satellites in both ambient and thermal testing conditions. Terms of the contract weren't disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • CNQR

    Nomura is starting coverage on richly-valued travel/expense management software vendor Concur...

    Nomura is starting coverage on richly-valued travel/expense management software vendor Concur Software (CNQR +4.9%) with a Buy and $80 PT. The firm thinks the Street is underestimating Concur's ability to act as an intermediary between businesses and hotel/car rental firms, and argues its growth and market-leading position, together with the consolidation wave hitting the cloud software market, could draw a buyer. Concur delivered an FQ3 beat last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • AKRX

    Shares of Akorn (AKRX +6.7%) move higher after its preliminary Q2 revenue beat estimates this...

    Shares of Akorn (AKRX +6.7%) move higher after its preliminary Q2 revenue beat estimates this morning. Revenue grew by 97% over the comparable prior year quarter or 37% excluding the impact of acquisitions. The company also guides its FY12 earnings higher, now expecting to earn between $0.50 - $0.52 on revenue of $248M - $258M, versus previous expectations of $0.44 - $0.46 per share on revenue of $228M - 238M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK +4.6%) jumps after Credit Suisse starts coverage with an Outperform and $40 PT. The...

    Splunk (SPLK +4.6%) jumps after Credit Suisse starts coverage with an Outperform and $40 PT. The machine data software leader has tread water in recent months, following a stellar April IPO that left it with a sky-high valuation. Several other high-beta enterprise tech names are also up strongly today.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP +5.9%) surges after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $45 PT ahead of next...

    NetApp (NTAP +5.9%) surges after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $45 PT ahead of next Wednesday's FQ1 report.
